source package¶

Submodules¶

source.generate_apidoc module¶

Use sphinx’s extension “apidoc” to generate the documentation.

Step on the folder ‘2-documenting’.

Uncomment from the conf.py file:

import os import sys sys.path.insert(0, os.path.abspath(‘..’))

Add extensions to conf.py:
extensions = [

‘sphinx.ext.autodoc’, ‘sphinx.ext.viewcode’ ]

Run:

‘$ sphinx-apidoc -o docs source’

-ooutput

docs folder

source : package I want to generate documentation for

Go to /docs and run:

‘$ make clean html’

source.sphinx-demo module¶

source.type_hints module¶

TYPE HINTS:

Make python statically typed

find type hints in GREEN

class source.type_hints.FireBreath[source]¶

Bases: source.type_hints.Weapon

FireBreath is a weapon only wielded by dragons or wizards. It can deal a lot of damage, but it also has its drawbacks. There is a 30% chance that the attack will not work, and after a successful attack you will need to wait a while before you will be able to breath fire again.

attack() → Tuple[int, str][source]¶

This method should return a tuple (damage, text): how much damage was dealt and what text to output. Text is a format string with placeholders for attacker and defender.

class source.type_hints.Player(name: str, weapon: source.type_hints.Weapon, health: int)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Player class represents the characters in the game.

Variables

health – The current health of the character. Starts at 100. Once it reaches 0, we’re dead.

property is_alive¶

True if health is larger than 0, False otherwise

take_hit(damage: int) → int[source]¶
class source.type_hints.Sword[source]¶

Bases: source.type_hints.Weapon

A primitive close-range weapon. It deals either 5 or 10 damage with a 50/50 chance.

attack() → Tuple[int, str][source]¶

This method should return a tuple (damage, text): how much damage was dealt and what text to output. Text is a format string with placeholders for attacker and defender.

class source.type_hints.Weapon[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

This abstract class defines the method attack() that should be implemented by subclasses.

abstract attack(other) → Tuple[int, str][source]¶

This method should return a tuple (damage, text): how much damage was dealt and what text to output. Text is a format string with placeholders for attacker and defender.
